“Bhikkhus, there are these five faculties.

original: Yato kho, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako imesaṁ pañcannaṁ indriyānaṁ assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādāvimutto hoti—🔽ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu arahaṁ khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojano sammadaññāvimutto”ti.
analyzed: yatas kho bhikkhave ariya sāvakaḥ imesam pañcannam indriyānam assādam ca ādīnavam ca nissaraṇam ca yathābhūtam viditvā an upādā vimuttaḥ hoti  ayam vuccati bhikkhave bhikkhu araham khīṇa āsavaḥ vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ ohita bhāraḥ an uppatta sadattho parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanaḥ sammadaññā vimutto ti
translated: When a noble disciple has thus understood the allure, the danger, and the escape in the case of these five faculties, they are then called a noble disciple of direct knowledge, one who has arrived at this true Dhamma, who sees this true Dhamma, who has perfect confidence in this true Dhamma.🔽They can’t fall back, for they are established in the supreme return.🔽They are finished with the lower realms, for they are incapable of wrongness.🔽They are destined for penetration, for they are incapable of retrogression.🔽They are destined for full awakening, for they are incapable of not awakening.🔽They are destined for heaven, for they are incapable of bad actions.

In the four right efforts.

In the four establishments of mindfulness.
That’s where the mindfulness faculty is to be seen.

The First Analysis
“Monks, there are these five faculties.
What five?
The faith faculty, the energy faculty, the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty, and the wisdom faculty.
“And what, bhikkhus, is the faith faculty?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṁ:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvako saddhaḥ hoti saddahati tathāgatassa bodhi
translated: Here a noble disciple is endowed with faith. He has faith in the enlightenment of the Tathagata thus:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti—
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed One is an arahant, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in true knowledge and conduct, fortunate, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of persons to be tamed, teacher of devas and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One.’
This is called the faith faculty.
“And what, bhikkhus, is the energy faculty?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako āraddhavīriyo viharati akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya, kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvakaḥ āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya kusalānam dhammānam upasampadāya thāmavā daḷha parakkamaḥ a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu dhammesu
translated: Here a noble disciple dwells with energy aroused for the abandoning of unwholesome states and the acquisition of wholesome states. He is strong, firm in exertion, not shirking the responsibility of cultivating wholesome states.
This is called the energy faculty.
“And what, bhikkhus, is the mindfulness faculty?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā anussaritā—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvako satimā hoti paramena sati nepakkena samannāgataḥ cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā anussaritā
translated: There is the case where a noble disciple is mindful, possessing supreme mindfulness & discretion, one who remembers & remembers well what was said & done long ago.
This is called the faculty of mindfulness.
“And what is the faculty of concentration?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako vossaggārammaṇaṁ karitvā labhati samādhiṁ, labhati cittassa ekaggataṁ—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvakaḥ vossagga ārammaṇam karitvā labhati samādhi labhati cittassa ekagga ta
translated: There is the case where a noble disciple, having abandoned desire for sensual pleasures, remains focused on the drawback of sensual pleasures, percipient of the drawback of sensual pleasures.
This is called the faculty of concentration.
“And what is the faculty of discernment?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako paññavā hoti udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya, sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvako paññavā hoti udaya ttha gāminiyā paññāya samannāgataḥ ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkha kkhaya gāminiyā
translated: There is the case where a noble disciple is discerning, endowed with discernment of arising & passing away—noble, penetrating, leading to the right ending of stress.
This is called the faculty of discernment.

analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave pañca indriyāni iti
translated: “These are the five faculties.”

original: Yaṁ hissa, sāriputta, vīriyaṁ tadassa vīriyindriyaṁ.

original: Saddhassa hi, sāriputta, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa etaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ yaṁ satimā bhavissati, paramena satinepakkena samannāgato, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi saritā anussaritā.
analyzed: saddhassa hi sāriputta ariya sāvakassa āraddha vīriyassa etam pāṭikaṅkham yam satimā bhavissati paramena sati nepakkena samannāgataḥ cira katam pi cira bhāsitam pi saritā anussaritā
translated: It is to be expected that a faithful disciple of the noble ones, who has gone forth out of faith, will be mindful, possessing supreme mindfulness & alertness, remembering & able to call to mind even things that were done & said long ago.

original: Yā hissa, sāriputta, sati tadassa satindriyaṁ.
analyzed: yā hi ssa sāriputta sati tat assa sati indriya
translated: For his mindfulness is the faculty of mindfulness.

original: Saddhassa hi, sāriputta, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino etaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ yaṁ vossaggārammaṇaṁ karitvā labhissati samādhiṁ, labhissati cittassa ekaggataṁ.
analyzed: saddhassa hi sāriputta ariya sāvakassa āraddha vīriyassa upaṭṭhita ssatino etam pāṭikaṅkham yam vossagga ārammaṇam karitvā labhissati samādhi labhissati cittassa ekagga taṇhā
translated: It is to be expected that a faithful disciple of the noble ones, who has gone forth out of faith, will, with the abandoning of pleasure & pain—as with the earlier disappearance of elation & distress—enter & remain in the fourth jhāna: purity of equanimity & mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain.

original: Yo hissa, sāriputta, samādhi tadassa samādhindriyaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ hi sāriputta samādhi tat assa samādhindriya
translated: For his equanimity is the faculty of equanimity.

original: Saddhassa hi, sāriputta, ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino samāhitacittassa etaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ yaṁ evaṁ pajānissati—
analyzed: saddhassa hi sāriputta ariya sāvakassa āraddha vīriyassa upaṭṭhita ssatinaḥ samāhita cittassa etam pāṭikaṅkham yam evam pajānissati
translated: It is to be expected that a faithful disciple of the noble ones, who has gone forth out of faith, will understand: ‘Rebirth is ended; the holy life fulfilled; the task done. There is nothing further for this world.’

original: anamataggo kho saṁsāro.🔽Pubbakoṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṁ sattānaṁ taṇhāsaṁyojanānaṁ sandhāvataṁ saṁsarataṁ.
analyzed: anamataggaḥ kho sa sāraḥ 🔽na paññāyati avijjā nīvaraṇānam sattānam taṇhā sayojanānam sandhāvatam sasarata
translated: For his discernment is the faculty of discernment.

original: Avijjāya tveva tamokāyassa asesavirāganirodho santametaṁ padaṁ paṇītametaṁ padaṁ, yadidaṁ—

original: sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā kkhayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna

original: Yā hissa, sāriputta, paññā tadassa paññindriyaṁ.
analyzed: yā hi ssa sāriputta paññā tat assa paññindriya
translated: “Whatever wisdom he possesses is his wisdom faculty.

original: Saddho so, sāriputta, ariyasāvako evaṁ padahitvā padahitvā evaṁ saritvā saritvā evaṁ samādahitvā samādahitvā evaṁ pajānitvā pajānitvā evaṁ abhisaddahati:

translated: “The noble disciple, endowed with faith, recollects the Buddha in this way while walking, standing, sitting, and lying down. Thus, he is possessed of mindfulness of the Buddha.

original: ‘ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesuṁ.
analyzed: ime kho te dhammā ye me pubbe sutavā ahesu
translated: ‘These things that I have heard are well proclaimed by the Blessed One, who knows and sees, worthy, and rightly self-awakened.

original: Tenāhaṁ etarahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī’ti.

analyzed: yā hi ssa sāriputta saddhā tat assa saddhindriyanti
translated: Whatever faith he possesses is his faith faculty.”

translated: “Bhikkhus, as long as noble knowledge has not arisen in a noble disciple, his faculties are not yet matured and his brain is not yet fully developed.

translated: “Bhikkhus, just as, until the ridgepole is raised, the rafters lean and list and totter, and do not stand firm,

translated: so too, until a noble disciple has the noble knowledge and vision, his faculties lean and list and totter, and do not stand firm,

translated: “There is a method, monks, by which a monk in training, who is thus practicing, can know that he is in training.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṁ pariyāyaṁ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṁ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti?

translated: And what is that method?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: idha bhikkhave sekhaḥ bhikkhu idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti  yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: Here, a monk in training understands as it really is: ‘This is suffering,’ ‘This is the origin of suffering,’

original: ‘natthi kho ito bahiddhā añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yo evaṁ bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ tathaṁ dhammaṁ deseti yathā bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: na atthi kho itas bahiddhā aññaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā yaḥ evam bhūtam taccham tatham dhammam deseti yathā bhagavā ati
translated: ‘There is no other ascetic or brahmin outside of this who teaches a Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, who reveals a spiritual life that is utterly perfect and pure.’

original: Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṁ pariyāyaṁ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṁ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti.

translated: This is another way in which a monk who is training should understand that he is training in the training of the Noble One, that he is making an effort in the effort of the Noble One.

translated: “Again, a monk who is training understands the five faculties:
the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

translated: He does not experience those faculties with his body,

analyzed: ayam api kho bhikkhave pariyāyaḥ yam pariyāyam āgamma sekhaḥ bhikkhu sekha bhūmiyam ṭhitaḥ sekhaḥ asmi iti pajānāti
translated: This is the method by which a trainee bhikkhu knows he is a trainee.

translated: “And, bhikkhus, what is the method by which a bhikkhu who is an arahant, one whose taints are destroyed, knows of himself: ‘My taints are destroyed’?
